basics.name: Tim Jacobs
basics.label: Staff Software Engineer
basics.summary: Highly-accomplished Staff Software Engineer specializing in large-scale backend architecture, data engineering, and high-impact DevOps transformation. Proven ability to drive technical roadmaps, mentor engineers, and deliver pragmatic, quality-focused solutions that optimize value streams and enable data-driven strategy across an organization.

work.summary: Led development of scalable data ingestion frameworks, metadata systems, and cross-partner integrations supporting measurement, modeling, and reporting pipelines.
highlights: Architected and improved large-scale ingestion pipelines, including identity resolution flows, pixel metadata normalization, and multi-platform event streams.
Implemented and maintained complex Snowflake/dbt data models, backfills, clustering strategies, and high-volume ETL workflows supporting analytics and Data Science workloads.
Delivered numerous high-impact S2S and pixel integrations with major streaming, advertising, and data partners; built ingestion specs, metadata models, QA workflows, and verification tooling.
Drove organizational privacy and compliance efforts by automating deletion/de-identification and retention pipelines across all production environments.
Reduced operational overhead by improving observability, data quality, linting/CI, access patterns, account recovery automation, and cross-functional documentation.
Provided technical leadership, pairing support, and architectural design guidance across Data Science, Infrastructure, Product, and external technical teams.
Designed and delivered robust test architecture for a complex, event-driven microservices billing platform, significantly improving system reliability.
Implemented continual delivery practices and tooling for multiple microservices-based architectures, enhancing deployment frequency and stability.
Spearheaded the design and development of dozens of shared, highly-reusable components, establishing internal standards and accelerating delivery for multiple engineering teams.
Developed and implemented test architecture for microservices in golang and python using AWS services.
Operational data team lead, overseeing critical data workflows and system integrity.
Designed and implemented reference data re-architecture, moving mean commit to deploy time from weeks to hours.

work.summary: Test Lead, Product Owner, DevOps transformation contributor
highlights: Designed and led the implementation of a test result reporting database service, automating report generation for management.
Contributed to DevOps efforts, collaborating to reduce build failure rate by 50%.
Planned, automated, and triaged tests, enabling on-schedule feature delivery for 100% of features I led.
Served as **Product Owner**, responsible for technical direction and mentorship for a remote team of 12 engineers in Bangalore.
Conceptualized and contributed to the design of a new test framework, enabling the transition of 1000s of test cases to a containerized CI-driven environment.
Reduced by 6x the resource requirements of legacy test suites by refactoring code in two weeks.

work.summary: 4 Direct reports as supervisor supporting 4 OEMs
highlights: Enterprise and data center SAS/SATA SSD Qualification team supervisor supporting 4 products across 4 Tier 1 OEMs with 4 engineers.
Designed, implemented, and deployed qualification test status and statistic database with test script integration automating reports for management.
Rewrote automation client to satisfy compatibility teams requirements, reducing automation deployment schedule by 20 months, improving test execution and reporting efficiency by orders of magnitude.
Personally executed OEM qualification, integration, and maintenance release validation with continuous debug, root cause, and issue resolution enabling >$60M/qtr in revenue.
Supported OEM qualification by debugging to root cause hundreds of test script failures on a bi-weekly cadence to support release schedules.
Developed automated failure analysis debug scripts for FW team to reduce debug overhead by 30%.
Compiled MTTF, MTBF data on failure modes to enable program management, quality, and reliability teams to make data driven decisions supporting release schedules.
Championed test execution efficiency effort more than doubling validation coverage.

work.summary: Automated previously manual work control document production
highlights: Built instrument, material, schedule and design verification database with web interface and automated work control document production reducing field rework from dozens of engineer hours per week to zero.
Completed design and created procurement package for project Information Technology systems.
Reviewed instrumentation and controls designs, developed work packages and work control materials for electrical, instrumentation and controls installation and testing.
Supported product transfer from development in Longmont to production in Wuxi, China as failure analysis lead.
Delivered Seagateâ€™s first 7200 RPM mobile drive to production volumes at > 90 % yields.
Supported firmware selftest and manufacturing test with daily test performance and failure analysis feedback to cross functional core team.
Tested a prototype automotive hard drive across environmental extremes for performance and reliability.

interests.name: Machine Learning
keywords: design and test neural networks to predict the outcome of football and NCAA basketball games

interests.name: Gator wrestler, snake handler
keywords: Assistant handler of Alligators and Venomous Snakes at Reptile Gardens in Rapid City, SD. Extensive public speaking, not risk averse but very risk aware.
